review_findings.finding: Code style is consistent with surrounding code. The isPathContinuation variable follows the same descriptive const pattern as hasLeadingSpaces and isShortFragment.

Comments on lines 223-228 are accurate and complete. The four bullet points correctly describe the three conditions (third and fourth bullets map to the two parts of the isPathContinuation OR expression).
No code smells detected. The 3-condition OR (hasLeadingSpaces || isShortFragment || isPathContinuation) is simple and readable. Per YAGNI design policy, no additional abstraction is warranted.
Test structure in the 'Pattern 0: Multiple choice' describe block is consistent with existing Pattern 1-5 describe blocks. Uses the same it()/expect() patterns.
All 10 test cases have descriptive names and clear test data. Scope-limiting comments on lines 281-282 and 302 accurately describe what isPathContinuation covers vs. does not cover.

No redundant assertions found. Each test verifies a distinct scenario: standard, wrapped options, tilde path, negative (no indicator), yes/no fallback, regression, wide terminal, path continuation, and multiple path continuations.
